name: places/ChIJQcbkIAFZwokROc9ElLuGuZI

displayName.text: Consulate General of Mexico in New York

formattedAddress: 27 E 39th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 27 E 39th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: Worse consulate experience I ever had.  If I can give them negative 10, I would.  Was outside 10 minutes the before they open (7am) and there were others waiting as well.  It was raining and cold in December.  I saw several employees entered through the employee entrance thinking that I no longer have to wait any longer.  10 minutes after 7am and no one open the gate, but I can see employees looking out through the glass door.  20 minutes gone, still the same.  40 minutes gone, someone peek out from the employees entrance and said they are closed for the day.  No notice at the gate about the closure and no one came out to tell people waiting outside at 7am in the cold and rain while they were observing and enjoying people freezing.  When people complained, the employees said she was more concerned about loosing her voice because she had to come out to inform people about the closure.  The reason for the closure was training to provide better customer service.  I say they certainly need it.  I think they need better management training too.  Who closed the whole consulate for training?  Usually it's done in different groups so it does not impact productivity.

originalText.text: Not going to lie, i was hesitating to come renew my passport and matricula because of all the bad reviews, and stories i've heard. I use to come with my parents as a kid so when you become an adult and have to do things on your own, it's scary af. I did my appointment online got here on time had all my documents in order i even brought more documents than what i had to just incase, but from the moment i got there and received my items, everything was a 10/10. Jazmin helped me renew and she was helpful and patient!

Jazmin helped me renew and she was helpful and patient!

originalText.text: Made an appointment a week ago, was told my passport renewal would be like starting over, so they told me all I had to bring was my Birth Certificate and Driver’s license. I arrive on time, told them I have an appointment, and the lady asks me for my old passport, and I kindly tell her that I didn’t bring it because it wasn’t asked for, since it’s been 10 years since my last renewal. She disregarded it and said she can’t do anything about it, and I asked to make an appointment for tmw and she said I have to call the number again to do so. That makes no sense to me, how is it that I’m physically at the Consulate and you can’t make an appointment in house? What a waste of time.

originalText.text:
I am trying to help my mother apply for a Mexico Passport, we live in Upstate NY. Think Canada, so I wanted to be sure we had everything we need before traveling 6 hrs south. Also make sure we do not need an appt.
The number does not connect to anyone and once prompted English press 1. then repeats again for English press 1. I then stayed on the line waiting for other prompts.
When prompted to speak with person for documentation, press 1 and the line hangs up on you. I tried calling back and it hung up again.
It is as if this is a fake contact #. No prompts lead to assistance or a person to help connect.
If I could give 0 starts I would.

If I could give 0 starts I would.

originalText.text: Today, my parents went to apply for the INE  we got on line and the lady told us that they needed their birth certificate (which they did not have) The lady said they can get one on the third floor. They merrily went upstairs and were told that due their system was down they were not able to receive them. If their system was down, why didn’t the lady tell us from the start? Lack of communication
